data_block module

class data_block.DataBlock(data_list: List)

Bases: object

wrapper around a list of symbols.

The class is a wrapper around a list of symbols (self.data_list). The data_block is typically used to represent input to the data encoders (or output from data decoders)

Some utility functions (useful generally for compression) implemented are: - size - alphabet - empirical_distribution - entropy

get_alphabet() → Set

returns the set of unique symbols in the data_list

Returns

the alphabet

Return type

Set

get_counts(order=0)

returns a dictionary of counts for symbols in self.data_list

Parameters

  • order (int, optional) – (the order of k-mer for which counts need to be obtained) Defaults to 0.

  • counts (order 0-> symbol counts.. order 1-> tuple) –

Raises

NotImplementedError – If order !=0, as it is not implemented yet

Returns

{symbol:count, …}

Return type

dict

get_empirical_distribution(order=0) → core.prob_dist.ProbabilityDist

get empirical distribution for self.data_list of order 0

Return the empirical distribution of the given order. for e.g if data_list = [A,B,A,A], order=0 -> returns {A:0.75, B:0.25}. if data_list = [A,B,A,A], order = 1 -> returns {AB:0.33, BA:0.33, AA:0.33}

Parameters

order (int, optional) – the order of counts. Defaults to 0.

Raises

NotImplementedError – not implemented for order != 0 yet

Returns

the epirical distribution

Return type

ProbabilityDist

get_entropy(order=0)

Returns the entropy of the empirical_distribution of data_list

returns the entropy of the empirical_distribution https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entropy_(information_theory)

checks basic operations for a DataBlock
